smarty.datasets package¶

Responsible for holding and administrating the data: loading it into memory, maintaining its index and types, sending it to models.

smarty.datasets.datasets module¶

Holds baisc DataSet instance with all methods administrating its index and types. To see advanced methods inspect smarty.datasets.*prosperties

class smarty.datasets.datasets.DataSet[source]¶

Bases: TrainingProperty, StatisticsProperty

Object holding the accual data, allowing to name its columns and choose their dtypes. It’s data can be set and accessed via [] (like python’s list) - see below example

Variables:

  • matrix_ (np.ndarray) – array holidng the data (columns - its 1 axis), preferable to get it via .numpy() method

  • columns_ (np.ndarray) – at each position i holds name of ith column of the dataset (if not provided smallest not used number will be picked for name)

  • dtypes_ (np.ndarray) – at each position i holds dtype of ith column of the dataset

  • dummy_writer – allows to write columns to the dataset without changing their dtype, ex:

 1from smarty.datasets import load_data
 2import numpy as np
 3
 4ds = load_data("iris.txt")
 5# here ds["species"] will remain as dtype U, not uint8
 6with ds.dummy_writer:
 7    ds["species"] = np.ones((150, 1)) # overwrite entire "species" column
 8
 9print(ds[10, "petal_length"]) # 11th row of PentalLength column
10print(ds[1]) # entire 2nd column
11print(ds[11, :]) # entire 12th row
12print(ds[12, 3]) # 4th column, 13th row
13print(ds["sepal_width"]) # entire SepalWidth column
14ds[41, "sepal_width"] = 2.3 # set 42th row of "sepal_width" column to 2.3
15ds[36, 3] = 1.7 # set 37th row of 4th column to 1.7

Warning

Providing columns with missing data (ie “”) might cause them to convert to dtype of “U” or float regardless to your actions

_get_idx(name)[source]¶
Parameters:

name (str) – name of column to be searched

Returns:

index of first column named name

Raises:

AssertionError if column named name is not found in the dataset

_is_categorical(idx)[source]¶
Parameters:

idx (int) – column index

Returns:

True if column with index idx is categorical, False otherwise

add_c(c, columns=None, dtypes=None, pos=- 1)[source]¶

Adds column/s to a dataset

Parameters:

  • c (list | np.ndarray) – list or 1D np.ndarray for one column, list of list or 2D np.ndarray for multiple columns to be added

  • columns (list of str | None) – list - name for each column in c or None (auto naming with lowest possible number)

  • dtypes (list | None | any dtype) – None for auto dtype detection, any dtype that will be used for all columns in c, list of dtypes - one for each column in c

  • pos (int | list | np.ndarray) – position where to put new rows. *defaults to -1* - works like append, int to insert rows as one block, list of ints - for each row its desired location

Warning

providing dtypes=None with disabled auto dtype detection will cause usage of dtype choosen by numpy (in case of fed in list) or same as in fed in np.ndarray

add_r(r, pos=- 1)[source]¶

Adds row/s to a dataset

Parameters:

  • r (list | np.ndarray) – list or 1D np.ndarray for one row, list of list or 2D np.ndarray for multiple rows to be added

  • pos (int | list | np.ndarray) – position where to put new rows. *defaults to -1* - works like append, int to insert rows as one block, list of ints - for each row its desired location

Warning

Each row must be same length as number of columns in the dataset. DataSet will try to cast each value in the row to corresponding column’s dtype, which might change “0001” to 1 or cause an error (ex trying to case “tree” to uin8)

list of indexes of categorical columns in the dataset.

copy of self (maintaining all training prosperties as well, ex batch_size)

boolean indicating whether the dataset is empty.

from_object(matrix, columns=[], dtypes=[])[source]¶

Creates and returns DataSet object

Parameters:

  • matrix (np.ndarray | 2D nested list) – matrix containing the data

  • columns (np.ndarray | list) – list containing column name for each column in the matrix (not required)

  • dtypes (np.ndarray | list | dtype) – list containing dtype name for each column in the matrix (not required) or one single dtype (like str) that will be used for all columns

Raises:

AssertionError if matrix is empty

join(dt, pos=- 1, axis=1)[source]¶

Joins DataSet dt to itself

Parameters:

  • pos (int | list | np.ndarray) – position where to put new rows. *defaults to -1* - works like append, int to insert rows as one block, list of ints - for each row its desired location

  • axis (int) – 1 for column-wise join, 0 for row-wise join

smarty.datasets.datasets.FLOAT_TYPES = (<class 'numpy.float16'>, <class 'numpy.float32'>, <class 'numpy.float64'>)¶

List of float dtypes auto-detection will check, each one being a native np.dtype

smarty.datasets.datasets.INT_TYPES = (<class 'numpy.uint8'>, <class 'numpy.uint16'>, <class 'numpy.uint32'>, <class 'numpy.uint64'>, <class 'numpy.int8'>, <class 'numpy.int16'>, <class 'numpy.int32'>, <class 'numpy.int64'>)¶

List of int dtypes auto-detection will check, each one being a native np.dtype

smarty.datasets.stats_properties module¶

class smarty.datasets.stats_properties.StatisticsProperty[source]¶

Bases: object

Statistics methods for a DataSet

descr_cat(k=3)[source]¶

Prints statistical data about categorical columns of the dataset (if it is not empty, else prints ‘DataSet is empty’), like

  1. count of non-nan entires

  2. number of unique entries (empty entry is also counted as type of entry)

  3. entries frequency

  4. up to k most frequent items for each column

Parameters:

k (int) – number of unique entries to display

descr_num()[source]¶

Prints statistical data about numerical columns of the dataset (if it is not empty, else prints ‘DataSet is empty’), like

  1. count of non-nan entires

  2. mean value

  3. standard deviation

  4. minimum value, 25, 50, 75th percentile, maximum value

fill_nan(key, strategy='mean')[source]¶

Fils empty cells in the cols according to choosen strategy

Parameters:

  • key (str | list | int) – column name (str), list of column names (list of strs), column index (int) or list of columns indexes (list of ints)

  • strategy (int | str) – mean - fill with mean value from column, median - same as mean, remove - removes rows with empty cells, othweriwse will put value of strategy to empty cells

Raises:

AssertionError if key is not valid

Returns:

DataSet of dropped rows (if any)

head(num=5)[source]¶

Prints up to num first row of matrix_, or if dataset is empty prints ‘DataSet is empty’

Parameters:

num (int) – how many rows to print

info()[source]¶

Displays basic information about the dataset, like number of rows, columns, columns names and dtypes

smarty.datasets.training_properties module¶

class smarty.datasets.training_properties.TrainingProperty[source]¶

Bases: object

Training methods for a DataSet

Variables:

  • batch_size_ (int) – batch size

  • repeat_ (int | bool | np.inf) – how many times to repeat the dataset (False - do not repeat, np.inf will repeat forever)

  • shuffle_ (bool | int) – if False yielded batches will look the same, otherwise will be shuffled in buckets of size shuffle_

  • drop_reminder_ (bool) – if True last batch of each full dataset iteration is dropped if it is not full

  • target_classes_ (list) – target classes that are yielded separately from data_classes_ during training (for supervised algorithms)

  • data_classes_ (list) – data classes, if not set entire dataset is presumed to be consisted only from data_classes_

Note

It’s recommended to set upper variables via proper methods (look below)

_get_common_dtype(cols)[source]¶

Searches common dtype of selected data columns cols, it works under assumption that each of these columns is alredy numerical

Parameters:

key (int | list | str) – column name (str), list of column names (list of strs), column index (int) or list of columns indexes (list of ints)

Raturns:

np.float32 or np.float64

batch(batch_size=32, drop_reminder=False)[source]¶

Batches dataset

Parameters:

  • batch_size (positive int) – batch size

  • drop_reminder (bool) – weather or not to drop reminder

Returns:

self

get_data_classes(_rows=None)[source]¶
Returns:

np.ndarray of columns being marked as data or entire matrix_ if no target column is selected

Note

It presumes all categorical columns are preprocessed to numerical one, and try to cast output array to float to allow further computations

get_target_classes(_rows=None)[source]¶
Returns:

np.ndarray of columns being marked as target or an empty np.ndarray if there is no target

Note

It presumes all categorical columns are preprocessed to numerical one, and try to cast output array to float to allow further computations

repeat(opt=True)[source]¶

Repeats the dataset

Parameters:

opt (bool | int) – False - do not repeat (1 iteration), True - infinitive, int - how many times to repeat

set_target_classes(key=None)[source]¶

Allows to set the target classes for the dataset (supervised learning)

Parameters:

key (int | list | str) – column name (str), list of column names (list of strs), column index (int) or list of columns indexes (list of ints)

shuffle(opt=1000, seed=42)[source]¶

Shuffles the datasets

Parameters:

  • opt (bool | int) – False - do not shuffle, int - shuffle box size

  • seed (int) – random seed for numpy

steps_per_epoch_()[source]¶

Number of steps per epoch - number of batches yileded at each compleate dataset iteration.

train_copy(new)[source]¶

Sets new DataSet instance’s traiing variables equal to its training variables

Parameters:

new (DataSet) – new DataSet instance

smarty.datasets.utils module¶

smarty.datasets.utils.cross_val_split(ds, folds=3, shuffle=True, seed=42, drop_reminder=False, *args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Splits ds into folds seperate DataSets

Parameters:

  • ds (DataSet | np.ndarray) – a DataSet to be splited

  • folds (int >= 2) – how many folds to be created, has to be smaller than number of rows in the ds

  • shuffle (bool) – if True random rows are being shuffled, False - first fold uses n first rows, second n to 2n etc

  • seed (int) – random seed for numpy (used only with shuffle=True)

  • drop_reminder (bool) – if True last fold is skipped if not full

Returns:

list of DataSets, each one being seperate fold

smarty.datasets.utils.load_data(filename='', url='', header=True, sep=',')[source]¶

Loads data from given source and returns a DataSet object

Parameters:

  • filename (str | Path) – filename / path to source file

  • url (str) – direct link to source file, note: file should be open to downloads without any logins or captcha

  • header (bool) – True - furst line of file will be treated as header (columns names will be generated based on it)

  • sep (str) – seperator

Raises:

AssertionError if no source provided

smarty.datasets.utils.train_test_split(ds, split_ratio=0.8, shuffle=True, seed=42, *args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Splits ds into 2 seperate DataSets - one for training and one for testing

Parameters:

  • ds (DataSet | np.ndarray) – a DataSet to be splited

  • split_ratio (float between (0.0, 1.0)) – the split ratio (how many of the ds is to be put to a training set)

  • shuffle (bool) – if True random rows are being shuffled, False - first split_ratio * 100% of the ds will be put in the training set

  • seed (int) – random seed for numpy (used only with shuffle=True)

Returns:

training_ds, test_ds (both instances of DataSet)
